data.title: About Photon
data.meta_description: Learn about Photon, who we are, what we do, industries we serve, leadership team, our customers, #thinkbeyond insights etc.
data.text:
Srinivas is the Chairman and CEO at Photon, and has had a history of building category-leading, highly profitable companies. Since he was appointed Photon’s CEO in 2007, the company has generated hundreds of millions of dollars in revenue - creating billions of dollars in market value. Photon is the world’s largest and fastest-growing provider of Digital Experiences, building highly engaging Mobile-First experiences for industry leaders across Retail, Financial Services, CPG Manufacturers, Hospitality, Automotive, Healthcare & Pharma, among others.

In fact, over 40% of the Fortune 100 have chosen Photon as their Digital Agency Partner of choice. Prior to Photon, Srinivas was Founder, President and CEO at Infravio Inc, a Stanford University incubated Silicon Valley company, which was a pioneer in the Web Services and SOA Infrastructure space. Srinivas led the successful sale of Infravio to webMethods in 2006 for a little over $40 million after which Srinivas served on the webMethod’s CEO’s Executive Management team.

Srinivas began his career in 1997 as an equity and derivatives trader at JP Morgan and Credit Lyonnais Securities at Mumbai, India, running the largest Institutional trading desk in India when he was at Credit Lyonnais. The trading desk was ranked as the best in the country. Srinivas is an alumnus of the Indian Institute of Management (IIM), Calcutta and Birla Institute of Technology and Sciences (BITS), Pilani.

Mukund is the CTO at Photon. His strategic thought and technology leadership is the driving force for the innovation that Photon provides to its Fortune 100 customers. As a trusted technology advisor, he guides and advises CIOs on their evolving omni-channel and Digital strategy. He was previously VP - Product Development at webMethods, leading middleware technology firm. Prior to that he was co-founder and CTO at Infravio Inc, a Valley based company which was a pioneer in the Web Services and SOA Infrastructure space. Mukund has served as an active member and adviser to several standards organisations such as XML Schema, W3C Web Services architecture and Open Source web services. Mukund is an alumnus of Stanford University and is a Bachelor of Technology (B.Tech) from Indian Institute of Technology, Madras.

As Executive Vice President – Engineering Muhamad manages a multi-national team in India, Indonesia, Europe, and the United States of over 4,500+ people and is responsible for mentoring, leading and recruiting the engineering team. He provides technical and innovation direction for building Mobile, Social Network Apps, SOA solutions, and Web 3.0 applications. He has designed and implemented scalable cost-effective solutions for all clients and is involved in all aspects of sales, from pre-sales to contract signing and delivery.

Momo joined Photon with more than 10 years of experience in architecting scalable high-performance systems. Prior to joining Photon, he was a Principal Engineer at Applied Predictive Technologies. Prior to Applied Predictive Technologies, Muhamad co-founded Infravio along with Mukund and Srinivas in 1999 and was a Principal Engineer at Infravio. Muhamad has a Master in CS from the University of Pennsylvania where he focused his research on Peer to Peer Distributed Database.

Hariprasad is part of the Executive Leadership Team at Photon responsible for maintaining and developing strategic enterprise customer relationships. He takes the lead on delivering on our commitments to key relationships and in identifying opportunities to expand the scope of Photon’s involvement in these accounts. Hariprasad has been instrumental in ensuring Photon’s positioning with our major enterprise customers and has grown all our major enterprise accounts into multi-million dollar accounts. Prior to joining Photon, Hariprasad was Senior Product Manager at Servigistics, the leading provider of Service Lifecycle Management solutions to Fortune 500 companies. Prior to Servigistics, Hari was a Project Manager at i2 Technologies, the market leading provider of supply chain management solutions. Hariprasad has a Masters in Aerospace Engineering from the University of Michigan, Ann Arbor and a Bachelors in Mechanical Engineering from Indian Institute of Technology, Madras.

Annah oversees the creative team consisting of UX and UI designers, UX researchers and video editors, as well as the overall creative delivery of client projects spanning North America, Central and South America, and Europe. Annah has a solid background in tech, starting her career in development, with an undergraduate IT degree majoring in Data Communications and Artificial Intelligence. She transitioned to design with two design centric masters degrees over her career with the most recent from the internationally renowned art school, Central Saint Martins. Her career has spanned across roles in Melbourne, London, and New York and she has worked on a wide breadth clients in a range of verticals including M&Ms (New York), L’Oréal (Paris), Walgreens Boots Alliance (London), Metlife (Mexico City), Olive Garden (Orlando), Petco (San Diego) and Neiman Marcus (Dallas).

Deepak Sharma is part of the executive leadership team at Photon accountable for Strategy Consulting, Pre-Sales, and Customer Success. He leads with clients on shaping their digital innovation agenda. Deepak is instrumental in collaborating with clients on designing future consumer experiences and building joint transformation roadmaps with our major enterprise customers. He is responsible for shaping our industry-leading Customer Success model for services. Prior to Photon, Deepak was a Partner/Managing Director at Deloitte Consulting where he co-founded Deloitte's Customer Success practice focused on driving customer and digital experience transformations across a diverse portfolio of Fortune 500 clients. Before that he was an Associate Partner at IBM Global Services focused on leading customer experience transformation efforts across a large portfolio of B2B companies. Deepak has an MBA from R.I.T. (NY) and a B.E. (Hons.) Chemical Engineering from B.I.T.S. (Pilani) in India.

Tania Chopra is our Vice President, Account Management. She is responsible for driving and cultivating overall customer success across all industry verticals for strategic digital client partners.

Tania brings in 20 years of experience in Banking, Financial, and Payments technology. She has a proven track record of building excellent client relationships, leading large and complex negotiations, and executing multi-million dollar cost savings during her tenure at JP Morgan, Credit Suisse, Sun Trust Banks, and Bank of America.

Before joining Photon, Tania served as the Director of Loyalty Products and Services at Mastercard. Tania received her Bachelor’s in Supply Chain from Michigan State University and the Distinguished Young Alumni Award from the Eli Broad School of Business. In addition, she completed her Executive Education at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) and was selected for the Women’s Leadership program at Yale School of Management.

Sivaprasad Reddy is the Chief Operating Officer at Photon. As COO, Siva is responsible for global operations including project management office, delivery management operations, profitability, talent acquisition, talent engagement, HR, global infrastructure, facilities and administration. Siva is a seasoned hand with over two decades of expertise in the technology industry. He is an ex-Photonite and was the SVP of Operations at Photon between 2007 and 2012, prior to which he worked with Wipro as a Delivery Manager, primarily handling the F100 Accounts. Most recently, Siva has served as the EVP of Research and Analytics at Manthan Systems, a Big Data / Analytics company based in Bangalore.

Vignesh Raja is the Vice President of Sales and New Business Operations at Photon. He is responsible for implementing best practices in driving global sales. Vignesh brings with him 20+ years of experience working with Wipro, Sutherland Global Services and prior engagements in software service sales for F500 and G2000 enterprises. Since joining Photon, he has played a key leadership role in driving sustainable growth, winning new customer logos and managing key client relationships that have helped Photon become an industry leader. Collaborating closely with Photon’s founders, Vignesh sources the best ideas across Internet consulting, mobility, IT sales, IT services, operations, customer support, and relationship management. Vignesh holds a Bachelor’s in Computer Applications and an MBA degree from the University of Madras in India.

Rajat is the Chief Strategy Officer at Photon. In his career spanning more than 25 years, Rajat has gained extensive experience in the Banking and Financial Services sector, primarily in Corporate and Investment Banking managing strategic corporate relationships and leading complex structured transactions. He has worked with premier banks / financial institutions like Standard Chartered Bank, IDFC First Bank, ICICI Group, GE Capital and Fitch Ratings. Rajat has also worked with one of the e-learning pioneers of India – egurucool.com, managing corporate finance and business planning. His last stint before joining Photon was with the Global Group Treasury team of Jindal Steel & Power Ltd.

Rajat is an alumnus of the Indian Institute of Management, Calcutta (IIM-C) and the Indian Institute of Technology (BHU), Varanasi (IIT-BHU Varanasi).

Manga Pidaparti is the AVP of Human Resources at Photon with over 20 years of experience in progressively leading effective HR teams and developing human resource frameworks and strategies for organizations in the IT industry.

She brings a unique combination of detail-oriented thinking with an acute focus on the big picture. She is also an excellent mentor to her team. This is Manga’s second stint at Photon and her responsibilities at Photon and elsewhere, have included, but are not limited to, talent acquisition, compliance, immigration, and training. She has implemented strategic plans for talent acquisition and retention, succession planning, people development, and employee relations at Photon and other organizations.

Prior to joining Photon, she worked with Infosys and Prodapt. She has been a leader in the HR space with over 12 years of experience as a Recruiting Manager, helming teams of 5–40 in an offshore/onsite model.

Gopalakrishnan Venkatesh is a member of the Photon Advisory Board. He has served as a member of our board of directors since 2015. As the Managing Member of Texan Ventures, a venture capital firm, since 2001, Mr. Venkatesh has a significant operating and investment background in the technology space. Before that, he was Vice President and General Manager at Broadcom from 1999 to 2001. From 2001 to 2007, Mr. Venkatesh served as a member of the board of directors and Chairman of the Board of Ikanos Communications. He has also served on several private and public boards, including active roles on several committees. Mr. Venkatesh holds a B.Tech in Electronics from the Indian Institute of Technology, Madras, India, and an M.S. in Electronics and Computer Engineering from the University of Massachusetts, Amherst, MA.
